summary: The Law Enforcement Training for Mental Health Crisis Response Act of 2025 aims to provide grants to state, local, and Tribal law enforcement and corrections agencies. These grants will fund behavioral health crisis response training for officers, with the goal of improving officer and public safety, and effectively resolving mental health crises. The bill amends the Omnibus Crime Control and Safe Streets Act of 1968, outlining program standards, application requirements, and reporting obligations. It emphasizes training in de-escalation, understanding mental health, and community resource navigation."
